Mais franchement RIEN de choquant.-Si vous regardez bien les deux souris au niveau forme esth√©tique, la HP est plus travaill√©e, plus design, enfin c'est ce que dit MON CHAT.‚û°Ô∏è CONCLUSIONTr√®s content de mon achat (je dois dire de mes DEUX achats), pour un prix d√©risoire, j'ai DEUX souris diff√©rentes que je n'arrive pas √† d√©partager.Peut √™tre, en lisant mon commentaire, vous choisirez plut√¥t l'une ou l'autre, selon ce que vous recherchez.Je les garde toutes les deux avec plaisir et je pense que je ne vais plus jamais prendre des souris sans fils.Ces souris filaires sont tr√®s tr√®s fiables et bon march√©, alors ... que demander de plus ?‚û°Ô∏è LE MOT DE LA FINJe valorise toujours  tous les produits / entreprises qui en valent la peine et qui le m√©ritent.A l‚Äôoppos√©, je critiquerai et d√©noncerai avec objectivit√© et arguments, les produits qui ne m‚Äôont pas donn√© satisfaction.Toutes bonnes choses m√©ritent d‚Äô√™tre partag√©es honn√™tement avec la communaut√©.Toutes mauvaises affaires ou produits non conformes m√©ritent tout autant, voire encore plus, d‚Äô√™tre signal√©es.C‚Äôest √† √ßa que servent les commentaires et les critiques.Mon honn√™tet√© et mon objectivit√© ne sont pas √† vendre.J'esp√®re que ce commentaire vous a √©t√© UTILE.Si c‚Äôest le cas, prenez le temps juste une demi-seconde pour cliquer sur OUI / UTILE ci-dessous, vous venez de m‚Äôoffrir ‚Äúun caf√© virtuel‚Äù avec le sourire.Cela ne me rapporte rien si ce n‚Äôest qu‚Äô une grande satisfaction et un √©norme encouragement pour vous √©crire encore plein d‚Äôautres commentaires.Merci √† vous.

titulo: Mouse Gamer Corsair Nightsword RGB 8 Bot√µes 18000 DPI Preto - CH-9306011-NA
comentario: Impressions after 1 week. May update if something goes wrong later, otherwise see you in a few years.----------------------------------------------------------------------My hands measure 18 x 10 cm and I use a palm grip. Length is measured from tip of middle finger to base of palm, and width is measured from edge of pinky to edge of thumb when all fingers are placed together.I've mained 4 mice over the years, including this one. M65 RGB, M65 RGB Elite, Razer Basilisk x Hyperspeed, and this Corsair Nightsword. The original M65 RGB was a real tank that lasted me 5+ years of hard usage. The switches are still 100% responsive, but I ruined the surface coat with acetone so I upgraded to the Elite. The M65 Elite started losing responsiveness in the left click after 4 months. The Basilisk x Hyperspeed was meant to be my wireless mouse while commuting. It felt decently comfortable in store and the shape was very well done except for a slightly-off hump placement, but after a while of using it, I realized the mouse was not wide enough for my hands, which would cause some discomfort after continuous use. But for my typical not-so-heavy usage while on the go, it is acceptable. The M65/Elite (both have nearly the same form factor) has been my daily driver for nearly 6 years so I will be doing a lot of comparison with it.Now the reason I'm talking about all these other mice is so you can get other comparisons of what mice I find comfortable. Mouse shape is the most subjective and also important factor when choosing a mouse. In particular grip width matters the most. I didn't think I had massive hands but apparently I do. To this date the only other mouse that has felt comfortable to me is the Corsair M65. I've tried all sorts of mice from Logitech and Razer, that all had raving reviews, including the G502 which the Nightsword was modeled after. All of them felt extremely uncomfortable to me with poor hump placement, small grip width, uncomfortable side button positioning, etc. The Roccat Kone Aimo supposedly also has a good size for my hands, but I have yet to try it out as stores will rarely put Roccats on display.----------------------------------------------------------------------Anyways, about the actual Nightsword.Feel/Comfort:This mouse feels like it was literally made for my hands. My hand dimensions are a little unusual, even compared to other 18 x 10 cm hands, as I have very long fingers relative to my palm size. This makes it even more difficult to find a good mouse. I can't really describe the feeling when I first tried it out in store before. I have never felt this level of comfort on any mouse, not even the M65, which is pretty comfortable, but not on this level. The Nightsword has curves in all the right places, buttons at the right positions, and my hand can rest on it effortlessly without having to cramp up my palm at all. The thumb wing is extremely nice as well. The sniper button is placed right near the tip of my thumb, which is the ideal position to hit it without having to bend or stretch at all. I can easily swing my thumb up to hit the forward and back buttons above it. The DPI switches which are cut out of the left click take some more effort to hit, but I don't really use them much for now. Still figuring out the optimal way to hit them. I can actually reach one comfortably with my thumb, and the other with my index finger.Weight:This mouse is way too heavy, even with all weights removed. I have to actually consciously grip the mouse a bit harder than usual when trying to lift the mouse up, otherwise it feels like it would slip out of my hand. Combined with the high LOD on this thing, it kind of feels like Corsair doesn't intend for you to ever lift the mouse. Center of gravity adjustment is a cool idea, but it feels like a gimmick right now.Sensor:The Nightsword uses the same PMW3391 optical sensor as the M65 Elite. Now here's the thing...for some unknown reason the Nightsword falls short of the M65 Elite's performance, despite having the same sensor. People say with high end mice, the sensor isn't a spec to look at because they are all practically the same, but I disagree. I have tried many different sensors that are all in this DPI range and 1000 Hz polling rate, but nothing else has felt as as silky smooth as the M65 Elite. In fact, not even the Nightsword with the same sensor feels as smooth. It's still great performance, but after experiencing the M65 elite, something is just lacking in the smoothness.The Lift-Off Distance (LOD) is also different from the M65 Elite. It feels ridiculously high, which is bad. The M65 Elite with the exact same sensor has one of the lowest LOD's on the market, at a height of 1 DVD thickness. The Nightsword is nearly 3 DVD's in LOD, while 2 is the current industry standard. This seems to be a common issue in other reviews, so it is definitely not a one-off.----------------------------------------------------------------------Buttons:This is really one of the huge flawed areas of this mouse. It seems like corsair got all the button actuation forces backwards.* L/R click:Split trigger buttons (buttons are completely separate cutouts from the main body of the mouse) and highly sensitive. I personally dislike split trigger but some people may disagree on this. When you have split trigger buttons there is less "springiness" and long term feedback to the button. If you need to hold down left or right click a lot for extended periods of time, this becomes a problem. It is very easy to accidentally let go of the button when you don't have that slight feedback of the button trying to spring back against your finger. Or, over time you start to press harder and harder which is also bad. The M65 Elite which was not split trigger had the perfect amount of feedback in my opinion. Split trigger can also sometimes jam the skin of your fingers in between the button, which was a problem on the Basilisk, but so far I haven't had this issue with the Nightsword. I also find the Nightsword L/R click to be a bit too sensitive. The first few days of use, I was constantly triggering the buttons by accident just by resting my hand on it, but I've adjusted now and it no longer happens.* Scroll/Middle click:Scrolling feels pretty good. It could be a tad bit less mushy, but I can still easily scroll one tick at a time and it doesn't ever move by accident. The middle click however, has some issues. It is not as firm as it should be. Applying a slight downward force without actuating it causes it to give way a bit and create a barely-audible creaking feedback as though the scroll wheel is loose.* Sniper Button:Interestingly enough this is actually the best button on this mouse. Perfect positioning, perfect actuation force. Well done.* Forward/Back:Takes WAY too much force to press. My thumb feels like it became 3x more buff after trying to hold down macros on these buttons (seriously). Additionally, the 2 buttons sometimes get stuck on each other. Press one, and it pushes on the other one, or sometimes even catches on the other when trying to release (you hear 2 "clicks" as the button tries to come back up). They are also slightly wobbly.* Profile Shift:Not too much to say about these except that they should be less sensitive. You'd think that they're pretty out of the way, but I have actually swapped profiles by accident a couple of times already. When flipping the mouse over to try out the weight system, they would constantly keep triggering just from the weight of the mouse.* DPI Shift:These have the same sensitivity as the L/R click, so I have the same opinion on that. The main thing about these is the shape. I understand that the intention was to keep the contour of the left click intact, but I would have liked to see the DPI-down button raised slightly higher so that it can be hit by rolling the index finger, without hitting the other buttons around it by accident.----------------------------------------------------------------------Build/Materials:I really like the left and right click material a lot on this mouse. Feels like a really high quality matte plastic and repels dirt really well. The glossy plastic on the side buttons gunks up extremely quickly and I don't even have sweaty or oily hands. The rubberized material on the rest of the mouse seems alright for now but it seems like it could deteriorate very quickly if you tried to scrub it for any cleaning. The textured surface seems to just be asking for gunk to get stuffed in the holes and be impossible to clean. We'll see. Scroll wheel and Forward/Back buttons could be less wobbly as I described before but otherwise build quality is very good.----------------------------------------------------------------------Final comments for Corsair:I really want to see you guys combine all the best things into one mouse. The form factor of the Nightsword + the M65 Elite's sensor, button build quality, material, and button actuation forces + optical switches (a lot of left/right click problems with many of your recent mice) + less weight, and maybe wireless. That would be my dream mouse.

titulo: Mouse Gamer Corsair Nightsword RGB 8 Bot√µes 18000 DPI Preto - CH-9306011-NA
comentario: I love the overall look and design of this mouse, I love the layout of the side buttons, I love the customization options, but I have three major problems with it. First the switch for the right click seems to have only half as much travel as the left click, and as a result is incredibly easy to accidentally click, I find it happening quite often from just operating the scroll wheel as my middle finger slightly pulls on my index finger as i flick the wheel, and that slight involuntary movement is enough to activate the right click. My second problem is closely related to the last one; the finger channel on the right click button pushes my fingers so close together that they are rubbing on one another and in the way of eachother, forcing me to rest my index finger on the raised edge of the channel further increasing accidental clicks. My third issue is the way the mouse slides across surfaces. Prior to this I was using a no name $30 ergo mouse, and that thing felt smooth as glass compared to this. It just feels and sounds abrasive, like it's being dragged instead of slid, at first I thought I must've forgotten to peel some film off the pads but after picking at them for a few minutes I was at a loss.I'm gonna try to get used to it and see it it doesn't get better, other reviews said this was a good mouse for people with large hands, the narrow finger channels kind of hamper that, at least if you use 3 fingers.

titulo: Mouse Gamer Corsair Nightsword RGB 8 Bot√µes 18000 DPI Preto - CH-9306011-NA
comentario: Impressions after 1 week. May update if something goes wrong later, otherwise see you in a few years.----------------------------------------------------------------------My hands measure 18 x 10 cm and I use a palm grip. Length is measured from tip of middle finger to base of palm, and width is measured from edge of pinky to edge of thumb when all fingers are placed together.I've mained 4 mice over the years, including this one. M65 RGB, M65 RGB Elite, Razer Basilisk x Hyperspeed, and this Corsair Nightsword. The original M65 RGB was a real tank that lasted me 5+ years of hard usage. The switches are still 100% responsive, but I ruined the surface coat with acetone so I upgraded to the Elite. The M65 Elite started losing responsiveness in the left click after 4 months. The Basilisk x Hyperspeed was meant to be my wireless mouse while commuting. It felt decently comfortable in store and the shape was very well done except for a slightly-off hump placement, but after a while of using it, I realized the mouse was not wide enough for my hands, which would cause some discomfort after continuous use. But for my typical not-so-heavy usage while on the go, it is acceptable. The M65/Elite (both have nearly the same form factor) has been my daily driver for nearly 6 years so I will be doing a lot of comparison with it.Now the reason I'm talking about all these other mice is so you can get other comparisons of what mice I find comfortable. Mouse shape is the most subjective and also important factor when choosing a mouse. In particular grip width matters the most. I didn't think I had massive hands but apparently I do. To this date the only other mouse that has felt comfortable to me is the Corsair M65. I've tried all sorts of mice from Logitech and Razer, that all had raving reviews, including the G502 which the Nightsword was modeled after. All of them felt extremely uncomfortable to me with poor hump placement, small grip width, uncomfortable side button positioning, etc. The Roccat Kone Aimo supposedly also has a good size for my hands, but I have yet to try it out as stores will rarely put Roccats on display.----------------------------------------------------------------------Anyways, about the actual Nightsword.Feel/Comfort:This mouse feels like it was literally made for my hands. My hand dimensions are a little unusual, even compared to other 18 x 10 cm hands, as I have very long fingers relative to my palm size. This makes it even more difficult to find a good mouse. I can't really describe the feeling when I first tried it out in store before. I have never felt this level of comfort on any mouse, not even the M65, which is pretty comfortable, but not on this level. The Nightsword has curves in all the right places, buttons at the right positions, and my hand can rest on it effortlessly without having to cramp up my palm at all. The thumb wing is extremely nice as well. The sniper button is placed right near the tip of my thumb, which is the ideal position to hit it without having to bend or stretch at all. I can easily swing my thumb up to hit the forward and back buttons above it. The DPI switches which are cut out of the left click take some more effort to hit, but I don't really use them much for now. Still figuring out the optimal way to hit them. I can actually reach one comfortably with my thumb, and the other with my index finger.Weight:This mouse is way too heavy, even with all weights removed. I have to actually consciously grip the mouse a bit harder than usual when trying to lift the mouse up, otherwise it feels like it would slip out of my hand. Combined with the high LOD on this thing, it kind of feels like Corsair doesn't intend for you to ever lift the mouse. Center of gravity adjustment is a cool idea, but it feels like a gimmick right now.Sensor:The Nightsword uses the same PMW3391 optical sensor as the M65 Elite. Now here's the thing...for some unknown reason the Nightsword falls short of the M65 Elite's performance, despite having the same sensor. People say with high end mice, the sensor isn't a spec to look at because they are all practically the same, but I disagree. I have tried many different sensors that are all in this DPI range and 1000 Hz polling rate, but nothing else has felt as as silky smooth as the M65 Elite. In fact, not even the Nightsword with the same sensor feels as smooth. It's still great performance, but after experiencing the M65 elite, something is just lacking in the smoothness.The Lift-Off Distance (LOD) is also different from the M65 Elite. It feels ridiculously high, which is bad. The M65 Elite with the exact same sensor has one of the lowest LOD's on the market, at a height of 1 DVD thickness. The Nightsword is nearly 3 DVD's in LOD, while 2 is the current industry standard. This seems to be a common issue in other reviews, so it is definitely not a one-off.----------------------------------------------------------------------Buttons:This is really one of the huge flawed areas of this mouse. It seems like corsair got all the button actuation forces backwards.* L/R click:Split trigger buttons (buttons are completely separate cutouts from the main body of the mouse) and highly sensitive. I personally dislike split trigger but some people may disagree on this. When you have split trigger buttons there is less "springiness" and long term feedback to the button. If you need to hold down left or right click a lot for extended periods of time, this becomes a problem. It is very easy to accidentally let go of the button when you don't have that slight feedback of the button trying to spring back against your finger. Or, over time you start to press harder and harder which is also bad. The M65 Elite which was not split trigger had the perfect amount of feedback in my opinion. Split trigger can also sometimes jam the skin of your fingers in between the button, which was a problem on the Basilisk, but so far I haven't had this issue with the Nightsword. I also find the Nightsword L/R click to be a bit too sensitive. The first few days of use, I was constantly triggering the buttons by accident just by resting my hand on it, but I've adjusted now and it no longer happens.* Scroll/Middle click:Scrolling feels pretty good. It could be a tad bit less mushy, but I can still easily scroll one tick at a time and it doesn't ever move by accident. The middle click however, has some issues. It is not as firm as it should be. Applying a slight downward force without actuating it causes it to give way a bit and create a barely-audible creaking feedback as though the scroll wheel is loose.* Sniper Button:Interestingly enough this is actually the best button on this mouse. Perfect positioning, perfect actuation force. Well done.* Forward/Back:Takes WAY too much force to press. My thumb feels like it became 3x more buff after trying to hold down macros on these buttons (seriously). Additionally, the 2 buttons sometimes get stuck on each other. Press one, and it pushes on the other one, or sometimes even catches on the other when trying to release (you hear 2 "clicks" as the button tries to come back up). They are also slightly wobbly.* Profile Shift:Not too much to say about these except that they should be less sensitive. You'd think that they're pretty out of the way, but I have actually swapped profiles by accident a couple of times already. When flipping the mouse over to try out the weight system, they would constantly keep triggering just from the weight of the mouse.* DPI Shift:These have the same sensitivity as the L/R click, so I have the same opinion on that. The main thing about these is the shape. I understand that the intention was to keep the contour of the left click intact, but I would have liked to see the DPI-down button raised slightly higher so that it can be hit by rolling the index finger, without hitting the other buttons around it by accident.----------------------------------------------------------------------Build/Materials:I really like the left and right click material a lot on this mouse. Feels like a really high quality matte plastic and repels dirt really well. The glossy plastic on the side buttons gunks up extremely quickly and I don't even have sweaty or oily hands. The rubberized material on the rest of the mouse seems alright for now but it seems like it could deteriorate very quickly if you tried to scrub it for any cleaning. The textured surface seems to just be asking for gunk to get stuffed in the holes and be impossible to clean. We'll see. Scroll wheel and Forward/Back buttons could be less wobbly as I described before but otherwise build quality is very good.----------------------------------------------------------------------Final comments for Corsair:I really want to see you guys combine all the best things into one mouse. The form factor of the Nightsword + the M65 Elite's sensor, button build quality, material, and button actuation forces + optical switches (a lot of left/right click problems with many of your recent mice) + less weight, and maybe wireless. That would be my dream mouse.

titulo: Mouse Gamer Corsair Nightsword RGB 8 Bot√µes 18000 DPI Preto - CH-9306011-NA
comentario: I love the overall look and design of this mouse, I love the layout of the side buttons, I love the customization options, but I have three major problems with it. First the switch for the right click seems to have only half as much travel as the left click, and as a result is incredibly easy to accidentally click, I find it happening quite often from just operating the scroll wheel as my middle finger slightly pulls on my index finger as i flick the wheel, and that slight involuntary movement is enough to activate the right click. My second problem is closely related to the last one; the finger channel on the right click button pushes my fingers so close together that they are rubbing on one another and in the way of eachother, forcing me to rest my index finger on the raised edge of the channel further increasing accidental clicks. My third issue is the way the mouse slides across surfaces. Prior to this I was using a no name $30 ergo mouse, and that thing felt smooth as glass compared to this. It just feels and sounds abrasive, like it's being dragged instead of slid, at first I thought I must've forgotten to peel some film off the pads but after picking at them for a few minutes I was at a loss.I'm gonna try to get used to it and see it it doesn't get better, other reviews said this was a good mouse for people with large hands, the narrow finger channels kind of hamper that, at least if you use 3 fingers.

comentario: Die Logitech G502 LIGHTSPEED Gaming-Maus setzt neue Ma√üst√§be in Sachen √Ñsthetik und Benutzerfreundlichkeit im Gaming-Bereich. Mit ihrer futuristischen, jedoch dennoch klassischen Form ist diese Maus √§u√üerst √§sthetisch und ein echter Blickfang auf jedem Schreibtisch. Ihre scharfen Linien und pr√§zisen Kanten verschmelzen zu einem Design, das sowohl futuristisch als auch zeitlos ist.Doch die Sch√∂nheit dieser Maus liegt nicht nur in ihrem Aussehen. Sie ist auch angenehm in der Hand, was f√ºr lange Gaming-Sessions unerl√§sslich ist. Die ergonomische Form der Gaming-Maus passt sich perfekt an die Hand an und vermeidet dadurch Erm√ºdungserscheinungen, selbst nach stundenlangem intensiven Spielen.Ein weiterer positiver Punkt ist der lang-anhaltende Akku der Maus. Mit einer einzigen Ladung kann man tagelang spielen, ohne sich Sorgen um einen leeren Akku machen zu m√ºssen.Erg√§nzt wird die beeindruckende Akkulaufzeit durch die schnelle Wiederaufladung der Maus. Es dauert nur eine kurze Zeit, bis diese wieder vollst√§ndig aufgeladen ist.Allerdings ist diese Maus nicht ohne ihre Schw√§chen. Bei meinem Exemplar ging der Dongle leider nach Monaten kaputt, was die Maus unbrauchbar machte. Gl√ºcklicherweise war der Kundenservice von Amazon sehr hilfsbereit und erm√∂glichte mir, die Maus problemlos zur√ºckzusenden.Insgesamt ist die Logitech G502 LIGHTSPEED eine hervorragende Gaming-Maus, die sowohl in Bezug auf das Design als auch auf die Funktionalit√§t punktet. Trotz des Problems mit dem Dongle w√ºrde ich sie aufgrund ihrer vielen positiven Eigenschaften jedem passionierten Gamer empfehlen.

¬†***Vorwort***Mittlerweile bin ich ziemlich skeptisch, was K√§ufe von Logitech-Hardware dank st√§ndiger Probleme mit Ausf√§llen anbelangt‚Ä¶hier seien besonders die Maustypen ‚ÄûG602‚Äú, ‚ÄûMX Master 2s‚Äú oder auch die ‚ÄûM705 Marathon‚Äú erw√§hnt.Kommen wir nun aber mal auf die ‚ÄûG502 Lightspeed‚Äú zu sprechen, bei der ich ‚Äì trotz des hohen Preises ‚Äì nicht widerstehen konnte, da mir das Ur-Model, die ‚ÄûLogitech Proteus Core‚Äú (ohne Spectrum!) √ºber einen langen Zeitraum ein treuer ‚Äì und ganz wichtig ‚Äì robuster Begleiter war.In all der Zeit ging mir daran nie etwas defekt, weder eine der Tasten, noch kam es zum Kabelbruch, noch war das Seitengummi abgenutzt. Da ich gerne auf eine kabellose Variante wechseln wollte, wurde sie allerdings dann irgendwann von mir ausgemustert, mittlerweile nutzt sie ein Bekannter und sie arbeitet noch immer perfekt.Nachdem ich gesehen hatte, dass es inzwischen die ‚Äûkabellose‚Äú Variante der G502 gibt und mir die fehlende Rechtsh√§nder-Ergonomie der G903 einfach nicht gef√§llt, hab ich mir die ‚ÄûLightspeed‚Äú kurzerhand im November 2019 per Warehouse-Deal in der 20%-Aktion bestellt und hier nun meine Eindr√ºcke und bisherigen Erfahrungen:***Verpackungsinhalt und Verarbeitung***Zur Verpackung muss ich sagen: ‚Äûein Traum‚Äú! :)Im Gegensatz zur letzten Maus (M705 Marathon) kein ‚Äûschneide-mich-auf-Plastik‚Äú sondern eine ordentliche Verpackung wie bsplw. bei der ebenfalls hochpreisigen G903, welche die Maus auch angemessen in Szene setzt.Nun, was findet man denn jetzt genau in dem kleinen Verpackungskarton?- G502 Lightspeed- USB-Ladekabel- Bedienheft- Warranty-Heftchen- ‚ÄûLogitech sagt Danke‚Äú-K√§rtchen- G-Aufkleber- kleines Plastik-K√§stchen mit Inhalt (dazu unten mehr)Die ‚ÄûLightspeed‚Äú ist verarbeitungstechnisch nicht anders als die von mir urspr√ºnglich genutzte G502 ‚ÄûProteus Core‚Äú, √§u√üerlich hat sich nicht wirklich etwas am Design ge√§ndert, lediglich der Sensor ist nun deutlich besser, sie ist nun endlich ‚Äûwireless‚Äú (Ein-/Ausschalter auf der Unterseite), es gibt eine RGB-Beleuchtung und die Powerplay-Funktion wurde eingef√ºhrt.Nichts an der Maus klappert, die Raster- und Freilauffunktion des Mausrads funktioniert einwandfrei, die Seitengummierung f√ºhlt sich ebenfalls sehr angenehm an, lediglich das Mausrad ist (leider) noch so laut, wie beim mir bekannten ‚ÄûUr-Typ‚Äú der G502. Die Abdeckung f√ºr die Gewichte auf der Unterseite der Maus ist unver√§ndert magnetisch geblieben, die Magnetkraft ist angenehm stark.In Bezug auf das USB-Ladekabel gibt es nichts gro√üartig zu bemerken, au√üer dass es sich um kein USB-C Kabel handelt und dass es schwarz ummantelt ist. An der Stelle sei erw√§hnt, dass mir die originalen Logitech-Ladekabel bisher tats√§chlich nie defekt gegangen sind.Das Bedienheftchen enth√§lt die n√∂tigsten Informationen √ºber kleine Schaubilder, die G-Tasten werden ebenfalls kurz erkl√§rt, wobei man sich diese sp√§ter auf Wunsch √ºber die Software (Logitech G-Hub) nat√ºrlich wunschgem√§√ü belegen kann.Kommentare zum Warranty-Heftchen und Danksagungs-K√§rtchen spare ich mir an der Stelle mal, der G-Aufkleber ist eine nette kleine Zugabe, hin kleben werde ich ihn mir jedoch nirgends. :)Kommen wir nun zu dem kleinen Plastik-K√§stchen, welches ein ‚ÄûG‚Äú-Symbol tr√§gt und in schwarz gehalten ist. √ñffnet man dieses nun, findet man insgesamt 6 Gewichte vor, n√§mlich 4x 2g und 2x 4g (hierzu weiter unten mehr), den USB-Funkempf√§nger sowie einen passenden Verl√§ngerungsadapter.***Erfahrungen***Die ‚ÄûG502 Lightspeed‚Äú bietet Nutzern des ‚ÄûPowerplay‚Äú-Mauspads den Vorteil, dass sie nicht manuell aufgeladen werden muss, stattdessen wird sie bei Nutzung des besagten Mauspads ‚Äûpermanent‚Äú geladen. Als bisheriger Nutzer des Mauspads in Kombination mit der G903 kann ich an der Stelle keine direkte Erfahrung schildern, wie lange nun der Akku ohne das Powerplay-Mauspad im Betrieb h√§lt, da ich die Maus ‚Äûgr√∂√ütenteils‚Äú auf dem Pad nutze. Die Powerplay-Funktion ist einwandfrei gegeben, Ladekabel und auch Empf√§nger werden in dieser Kombination gar nicht erst ben√∂tigt.Allerdings habe ich die Maus testweise mal an einem normalen Arbeitstag (8 Stunden) an einem Zweitrechner betrieben (ohne Powerplay) und es gab auch bei der Nutzung mit dem beiliegenden USB-Empf√§nger keinerlei Probleme (Aussetzer o.√§.) im Betrieb, der Akku nahm nur einige Prozent in der Leistung ab. Also sollte die vom Hersteller angegebene Akkulaufzeit durchaus erreichbar sein (abh√§ngig von der RGB-Beleuchtung!).Die Verbindung mit dem Powerplay-Mauspad ist recht einfach herzustellen, jedoch muss man bedenken, nutzt man dieses, kann man nur maximal die ‚Äû4x 2g‚Äú Gewichte einlegen, da dann der Chip f√ºr das Powerplay-Mauspad auf der Unterseite der Maus eingesetzt werden muss (s. Video), an dieser Stelle kommen eigentlich die 2x 4g Gewichte zum Einsatz. Schade aber war wohl nicht anders machbar.Die Software ‚ÄûLogitech G-Hub‚Äú bietet alle notwendigen Funktionen zum individuellen Einrichten der G-Tasten, ich pers√∂nlich nutze aber bis auf eine kleine √Ñnderung der RGB-Beleuchtung die Maus im Auslieferungszustand, da mir die Tastenbelegung so schon zusagt.Die Lightspeed ist ergonomisch f√ºr Rechtsh√§nder geformt, somit im Normalfall nicht f√ºr Linksh√§nder geeignet, sie liegt - f√ºr diejenigen, die das Modell ‚ÄûG502‚Äú noch gar nicht kennen ‚Äì sehr angenehm in der Hand, man verkrampft sich nicht und kann sehr sch√∂n damit arbeiten / zocken.Das Mausrad funktioniert sowohl mit ‚ÄûRasterfunktion‚Äú als auch im ‚ÄûFreilauf‚Äú sehr gut, lediglich die Lautst√§rke im ‚ÄûRasterbetrieb‚Äú h√§tte seitens Logitech auch noch √ºberarbeitet werden k√∂nnen, leider ist die Lightspeed hier genauso laut wie die Proteus Core. Schade.Die im Video angesprochene Aiming-Taste habe ich lustigerweise beim ‚ÄûUr-Typ‚Äú nie in der voreingestellten Funktion genutzt, mittlerweile finde ich aber gerade diese sehr hilfreich, da ich dahinter gekommen bin, dass man damit ‚Äûgenaue‚Äú Arbeiten mit dem Mauszeiger durchf√ºhren kann. Dr√ºckt man die Taste, schaltet sich der Mauszeiger bei Bewegung auf 400DPI runter und man kann bsplw. bei Ego-Shootern ruhiger zielen oder in Programmen (Bildbearbeitung usw.) schlichtweg genauer arbeiten.***Fazit***Eigentlich wollte ich so schnell keine Logitech-Maus mehr, der Preis f√ºr die G502 Lightspeed (und auch MX Master 3) ist noch immer zu hoch! W√§re ich nicht √ºber den Warehouse Deal gestolpert, h√§tte ich sicher die G903 weiterhin genutzt.Wer meine letzte Logitech-Bewertung (M705 Marathon) gelesen hat, versteht sicher, was ich damit meine.Die Preispolitik von Logitech kann (und will) ich noch immer nicht als gut bewerten, daher gibt‚Äôs entsprechend auch hier beim P/L-Verh√§ltnis ‚Äûnur‚Äú 3 von 5 Sternen.Aber es soll ja im ‚ÄûFazit‚Äú nicht nur um den Preis sondern das Produkt selbst gehen und da muss ich bei der ‚ÄûG502 Lightspeed‚Äú zugeben, es f√ºhlt sich an, als h√§tte man einen ‚Äûguten alten Freund‚Äú wiedergefunden.Diese Maus war in der ‚Äûalten‚Äú Variante meine bisher beste Maus, die ‚Äûneue‚Äú Lightspeed-Variante steht der alten ‚ÄûProteus Core‚Äú in keinerlei Hinsicht nach. Ich habe die Maus nun seit Ende November 2019 im Einsatz und konnte noch keinerlei Probleme wie Aussetzer, Doppelklicks oder √§hnliches feststellen.Als ‚ÄûKritikpunkte‚Äú k√∂nnte man an der Stelle das laute Mausrad erw√§hnen, hier sollte Logitech ggf. noch eine etwas leisere Variante in Betracht ziehen, weiterhin ist die Nutzung aller Gewichte nur beim Betrieb ohne das Powerplay-Mauspad m√∂glich.Das ist dann aber Meckern auf hohem Niveau, der einzige ‚ÄûNegativpunkt‚Äú ist der Preis.Gaming-Eigenschaft liegt bei ‚Äû5 Sternen‚Äú, die ‚ÄûErgonomie‚Äú ebenfalls, das P/L-Verh√§ltnis zieht die Gesamtbewertung mit ‚Äû3 Sternen‚Äú leider (eigentlich) etwas runter.Rechnen wir nun 5+5+3 sind wir bei 13.13 : 3 = 4,33‚Ä¶Aufgrund der positiven Erfahrungen mit der ‚ÄûProteus Core‚Äú und wegen der o.g. Sache mit dem ‚Äûguten alten Freund‚Äú gibt‚Äôs ausnahmsweise mal einen ‚ÄûFreundschaftsbonus‚Äú von 0,18 Sternen, somit runden wir auf 5 Sterne Gesamtbewertung auf.Ich halte Euch auf dem Laufenden, ob die Bewertung so bleiben kann.Kauftipp von mir.........sofern im Angebot!

titulo: Logitech Mouse sem fio G502 Lightspeed, sensor Hero 25K, 25.600 DPI, RGB, pesos ajust√°veis, 11 bot√µes program√°veis, longa vida √∫til da bateria, compat√≠vel com PowerPlay, PC/Mac - Preto

titulo: De'Longhi M√°quina de caf√© multifuncional e m√°quina de caf√© expresso + espumador de leite ajust√°vel avan√ßado para cappuccino e latte + cafeteira de vidro 10 x√≠caras, COM532M
comentario: I am so far, very happy to say I am very happy to have this new machine!1. Received it Feb 27th, 2023. Earlier than expected delivery date.  Started using the morning of Feb 28th.2. It was not a repackaged used machine that slipped through the cracks like it appeared to have in so many of the recent comments!!!!!  Thinking wherever those people are that got a repackaged used machine, must be serviced by an Amazon facility that has employees that don't care!!!  To them, if they read this, always let Amazon know!!!3. I drink MEDAGLIA D'ORO, which is Espresso Italian Roast ground coffee.  For that, cannot use the screen filter that comes with the machine.  Need to use the #4 filters which fit perfectly.4. Have not tried the Espresso side yet, but performing the initial setup per the instructions, everything worked beautifully and easily.  There were no leaks.5.  I place the machine on two layers of paper towels (4 sheets, folded in half) which fit the footprint of the machine almost perfectly. In other words, the footprint on the machine fits inside 2 sheets of Bounty paper towels.USING THE COFFFEE SIDE:One of the first things I noticed is the design of the Carafe. Either it needs an improved design, or the current design is to prevent any coffee grind sludge, that made it down from the drip, from pouring into your coffee cup/mug/tumbler.  There is about a teaspoon or less, that cannot be poured out.I use the Bold enabled button and seems to work well for boosting the flavor of the coffee.The touch buttons are a nice touch... no brute force needed for turning any knobs or pressing actual buttons... fewer moving parts means fewer mechanical failures.I set the clock on the machine on Thursday, March 2nd, and today, March 4th, I noticed it was a minute behind already.  Not a real bad thing, as it is easier to set the clock forward a few minutes due to it being slightly slow, than resetting the time back because it runs to fast.As for the filter and the reservoir for the coffee side, I wish the reservoir was removable like it is for the espresso side. Making it easier to clean than.  And as for the filter, I'll need to try and keep track of when that needs to be changed. Meaning have to set some reminder someplace "Check coffee reservoir filter to replace", gee... as if there aren't enough other reminders in life to list and keep track of!!! LOLI have not changed the default time for the warmer to turn off, as I am turning off the machine after the coffee is done dripping.OH... something I didn't see mentioned is... The machine has a BEEP (not loud) when done with the dripping.  That is a nice touch if you are still in proximity to the machine.  I like that as a reminder!!!That's it for now... will update later if and when I remember to.

titulo: De'Longhi M√°quina de caf√© multifuncional e m√°quina de caf√© expresso + espumador de leite ajust√°vel avan√ßado para cappuccino e latte + cafeteira de vidro 10 x√≠caras, COM532M
comentario: I‚Äôve wanted an espresso machine for awhile since buying lattes every morning is expensive. I figured this would be a good starter machine.The pros: It makes a good cup of coffee, I mean really good. Way better than the machine we had. It has nice features, it‚Äôs extremely easy to use, looks great in the kitchen, and was affordable. We use it every day with no problems. I can finally make a good latte in the morning. I feel spoiled.The cons: The quality of the espresso maker parts is poor. The portafilter is lower quality, the espresso seems to brew a little too fast at times, and don‚Äôt get me started on the wand. It‚Äôs flimsy and cheap and hard to steam milk so that it‚Äôs silky. The product designers definitely gave up. It would be much better with an upgraded steam wand. That being said, it does good enough for me and, given the price, it‚Äôs understandable.Overall, I do recommend this machine. However, if you‚Äôre a coffee aficionado and have the money, then a higher-end machine would probably suit your needs best.

That being said, it does an excellent espresso. Funnily enough, the box was missing the drip coffee maker pot, but the company is sending a replacement.

comentario: J'ai √©t√© tr√®s d√©√ßu quand j'ai re√ßu ma machine de constater qu'elle a √©t√© construite en CHINE , je sais pas pourquoi j'avais l'impression que DELONGHI √©tait fait en Italie . titulo: De'Longhi M√°quina de caf√© multifuncional e m√°quina de caf√© expresso + espumador de leite ajust√°vel avan√ßado para cappuccino e latte + cafeteira de vidro 10 x√≠caras, COM532M
comentario: I have waited to write a review because I wanted to use it for a few months first. I received this for Christmas, but I also picked this one out for my husband to get me. I read all the reviews about the leaking, noise, the length of time it takes and the frother. I also read all the great reviews. I decided out of all the machines out there, this one seemed to be the one that would most likely work in our kitchen and for our lattes.After using this machine for 3 months I can confirm it is noisy, but so are the ones at the coffee houses and it really does not bother me at all. If you are an earlier riser and you family will be annoyed with you for making your espresso or latte in the morning this may not be the right one for you. Does it leak. NO it does not leak. These people who say it leaks must be the laziest people on the planet. It will only leak if you do not remove water from the bottom where your cup sits. I also always dump the water after I am done making my coffee. It takes a while to warm up. If the light turns to a steady light before 5 mins it is not ready. For sure give it 5-10 mins to heat up. The frother works great if you heat up your cold milk first in the microwave just for a min. Otherwise it does take a little while. The foam is perfect. I bought a coffee grinder from XO and grinds the beans to the perfect espresso powder. The coffee tastes great. The coffee maker works great too. If you want a faster machine you will need to spend a $1000-$2000 for sure. I was not willing to do that since I still like to go to my local Starbucks.I am completely satisfied with this machine. My kids love it too.

titulo: De'Longhi M√°quina de caf√© multifuncional e m√°quina de caf√© expresso + espumador de leite ajust√°vel avan√ßado para cappuccino e latte + cafeteira de vidro 10 x√≠caras, COM532M
comentario: makes a properly blended cup of drip coffee and hot enough to drink without warming again, let it sit though for around 3 minutes after the cycle has ended. The espresso however has some minor issues. 1) the 1 cup filter does not fit only the two cup, 2) the ladle does not click to indicate locked or even an arrow imprint to line it up would work. 3) espresso not enoughMain thing I can fault are the instruction which come in two pamphlets which are not properly explained at all quite confusing. Offer a QR code with a video demo link or type out url. Otherwise Happy with this machine

comentario: Color : BlackSize : Large (believe it was previously named small)P r o s :-Adjustable padded straps.-The waist belt is nice for extended periods of walking.-Comfortable on my back. Some padding in the back. With a nice hidden area for items like your wallet.-Good at keeping things organized because it has lots of pockets-Lots of space inside the bag.-Nice material. I spilled some latte on it and it cleaned up easily. Everything inside stayed dry.-I like the shape. It's square. Not floppy.-It flattens down and stores well.C o n s :-The shoe pocket takes up space inside the main compartment. Which is a little annoying. But I like the idea of having a separate compartment for shoes to not dirty your clothes.-Water bottle pocket fits my size 18 oz hydro flask. My water bottle has a sleeve strap around the base. It was tricky sliding it into the pocket and I think the pocket could be bigger. The side pocket might be able to fit 22 oz but any bigger might be impossible to fit.O v e r a l l :I used this for a weekend road trip. It was the best bag I've ever used for travel. When I needed something it was nice to have easy access to everything. The trip was overnight to a location with warm weather. I had extra space in the bag. Since I had the space it was excellent tightening the straps to slim the backpack. You might be able to pack for about 2 to 3 days depending on how much you're packing and the climate.If you limit what you pack this would probably be good for a personal item on a plane. Be sure to measure it first and compare it with your airline's requirements. I can't wait to try it out on the plane. It has a strap to connect to a rolling suitcase. And I think it will work well with my packing cubes.My least favorite thing about this bad is that the shoe compartment makes it bulge and takes space from the main clothes pocket. And I wish the water bottle holder was bigger but I like that it flattens when it's empty.I've been pretty happy with it. I feel like this bag is the perfect travel bag for me!

titulo: Mochila de viagem grande feminina, mochila de m√£o, mochila de caminhada imperme√°vel para esportes ao ar livre mochila casual mochila escolar
comentario: Still a great bag, but I feel like my old traditional style back pack had a lot more room in it. This one has tons of different pockets, but you can't actually fit very much into them. All the pockets are extremely tight. I struggled to wedge my laptop into this bag and one of the corners still sticks out. It fits decently in the main compartment but not in the laptop section.The mesh bottle pockets are also extremely small. I think this bag was more designed to fit under a seat and everything you put on it just gets crushed to fit the dimensions. I had to get extremely creative to fit the few items I have in it.The shoe compartment is useless as it takes up the already limited space inside the main compartment. The pocket on the back is also very tight and shallow. I could fit either my phone or my wallet, but not both.I feel like I was a little misled by the tiktok reviews that got me to purchase this. I was made to believe you could fit a laptop and a couple days worth of clothes plus shoes and toiletries plus a phone and wallet and keys or meds..... this bag barely fits my laptop, switch, one RX bottle, a box of ibuprofen and my headphones.Good things about the bag :I like the strap on the back to hold your bag to a roller suitcase. Definitely helped save my back.The power bank port is nice. I have a larger power bank and that did not help my case with the lack of space, but being able to plug into the exterior of my bag instead of digging around for the bank at the bottom of my bag to use it was nice.The wet pocket is cool. I can shove my wet wipes and eyedrops in there without worrying of spillage. However I think that pocket is much larger than it needed to be.Overall it's a good bag. Just don't expect it to replace your carry on.

comentario: Color : BlackSize : Large (believe it was previously named small)P r o s :-Adjustable padded straps.-The waist belt is nice for extended periods of walking.-Comfortable on my back. Some padding in the back. With a nice hidden area for items like your wallet.-Good at keeping things organized because it has lots of pockets-Lots of space inside the bag.-Nice material. I spilled some latte on it and it cleaned up easily. Everything inside stayed dry.-I like the shape. It's square. Not floppy.-It flattens down and stores well.C o n s :-The shoe pocket takes up space inside the main compartment. Which is a little annoying. But I like the idea of having a separate compartment for shoes to not dirty your clothes.-Water bottle pocket fits my size 18 oz hydro flask. My water bottle has a sleeve strap around the base. It was tricky sliding it into the pocket and I think the pocket could be bigger. The side pocket might be able to fit 22 oz but any bigger might be impossible to fit.O v e r a l l :I used this for a weekend road trip. It was the best bag I've ever used for travel. When I needed something it was nice to have easy access to everything. The trip was overnight to a location with warm weather. I had extra space in the bag. Since I had the space it was excellent tightening the straps to slim the backpack. You might be able to pack for about 2 to 3 days depending on how much you're packing and the climate.If you limit what you pack this would probably be good for a personal item on a plane. Be sure to measure it first and compare it with your airline's requirements. I can't wait to try it out on the plane. It has a strap to connect to a rolling suitcase. And I think it will work well with my packing cubes.My least favorite thing about this bad is that the shoe compartment makes it bulge and takes space from the main clothes pocket. And I wish the water bottle holder was bigger but I like that it flattens when it's empty.I've been pretty happy with it. I feel like this bag is the perfect travel bag for me!

titulo: Mochila de viagem grande feminina, mochila de m√£o, mochila de caminhada imperme√°vel para esportes ao ar livre mochila casual mochila escolar
comentario: Still a great bag, but I feel like my old traditional style back pack had a lot more room in it. This one has tons of different pockets, but you can't actually fit very much into them. All the pockets are extremely tight. I struggled to wedge my laptop into this bag and one of the corners still sticks out. It fits decently in the main compartment but not in the laptop section.The mesh bottle pockets are also extremely small. I think this bag was more designed to fit under a seat and everything you put on it just gets crushed to fit the dimensions. I had to get extremely creative to fit the few items I have in it.The shoe compartment is useless as it takes up the already limited space inside the main compartment. The pocket on the back is also very tight and shallow. I could fit either my phone or my wallet, but not both.I feel like I was a little misled by the tiktok reviews that got me to purchase this. I was made to believe you could fit a laptop and a couple days worth of clothes plus shoes and toiletries plus a phone and wallet and keys or meds..... this bag barely fits my laptop, switch, one RX bottle, a box of ibuprofen and my headphones.Good things about the bag :I like the strap on the back to hold your bag to a roller suitcase. Definitely helped save my back.The power bank port is nice. I have a larger power bank and that did not help my case with the lack of space, but being able to plug into the exterior of my bag instead of digging around for the bank at the bottom of my bag to use it was nice.The wet pocket is cool. I can shove my wet wipes and eyedrops in there without worrying of spillage. However I think that pocket is much larger than it needed to be.Overall it's a good bag. Just don't expect it to replace your carry on.

comentario: I purchased this backpack for a recent trip to Italy. We wanted to travel with carryon luggage only. I was a bit concerned about not having enough space to pack my clothes and personal items for a 10day trip. I selected this waterproof backpack for functionality and for its cute style and color. It was absolutely perfect. It has zippers, pockets and compartments all in the right spaces. The zippers were smooth and did not get caught up or snag. It held so many items. I carried a change of clothes, shoes, cardigan sweater, make up bag, medication bag (gallon size), scarf, bag of snacks, face masks, money belt, a crossbody purse, backup battery pack and much more. It was stuffed full but the adjustable straps are padded and super comfortable and gave great support. My back never ached and it also fit easily over the handle of my carry on luggage. I could wheel both items with ease everywhere we went. The backpack also easily fit under the seat of the airplane. We moved around quite a bit through Italy and the pack back got move around a lot. It is built well and stood up through the wear and tear of constant train, plane and taxi rides. It was the perfect backpack for my travels. It is also very cute and stylish and feminine. I got the light powder blue color. I‚Äôm very happy with my purchase.

comentario: I refuse to check baggage on short trips, but I also can't live without all my favorite stuff. This bag has SO much space and types of storage, including a water proof compartment. There are two "tricks" I wasn't aware of when I first used it. One, there is a zip panel on the bottom that, when open, lets you slip your carry-on handle through the middle of the bag. Forget the little useless strap on the very back that's too tight to fit a handle through. Two, after the straps are over your shoulders remember to snap the chest strap. That strap takes the weight off the shoulder joint and squarely onto your shoulders where it is easier to carry.

titulo: Mochila de viagem grande feminina, mochila de m√£o, mochila de caminhada imperme√°vel para esportes ao ar livre mochila casual mochila escolar
comentario: Color : BlackSize : Large (believe it was previously named small)P r o s :-Adjustable padded straps.-The waist belt is nice for extended periods of walking.-Comfortable on my back. Some padding in the back. With a nice hidden area for items like your wallet.-Good at keeping things organized because it has lots of pockets-Lots of space inside the bag.-Nice material. I spilled some latte on it and it cleaned up easily. Everything inside stayed dry.-I like the shape. It's square. Not floppy.-It flattens down and stores well.C o n s :-The shoe pocket takes up space inside the main compartment. Which is a little annoying. But I like the idea of having a separate compartment for shoes to not dirty your clothes.-Water bottle pocket fits my size 18 oz hydro flask. My water bottle has a sleeve strap around the base. It was tricky sliding it into the pocket and I think the pocket could be bigger. The side pocket might be able to fit 22 oz but any bigger might be impossible to fit.O v e r a l l :I used this for a weekend road trip. It was the best bag I've ever used for travel. When I needed something it was nice to have easy access to everything. The trip was overnight to a location with warm weather. I had extra space in the bag. Since I had the space it was excellent tightening the straps to slim the backpack. You might be able to pack for about 2 to 3 days depending on how much you're packing and the climate.If you limit what you pack this would probably be good for a personal item on a plane. Be sure to measure it first and compare it with your airline's requirements. I can't wait to try it out on the plane. It has a strap to connect to a rolling suitcase. And I think it will work well with my packing cubes.My least favorite thing about this bad is that the shoe compartment makes it bulge and takes space from the main clothes pocket. And I wish the water bottle holder was bigger but I like that it flattens when it's empty.I've been pretty happy with it. I feel like this bag is the perfect travel bag for me!

titulo: Mochila de viagem grande feminina, mochila de m√£o, mochila de caminhada imperme√°vel para esportes ao ar livre mochila casual mochila escolar
comentario: Still a great bag, but I feel like my old traditional style back pack had a lot more room in it. This one has tons of different pockets, but you can't actually fit very much into them. All the pockets are extremely tight. I struggled to wedge my laptop into this bag and one of the corners still sticks out. It fits decently in the main compartment but not in the laptop section.The mesh bottle pockets are also extremely small. I think this bag was more designed to fit under a seat and everything you put on it just gets crushed to fit the dimensions. I had to get extremely creative to fit the few items I have in it.The shoe compartment is useless as it takes up the already limited space inside the main compartment. The pocket on the back is also very tight and shallow. I could fit either my phone or my wallet, but not both.I feel like I was a little misled by the tiktok reviews that got me to purchase this. I was made to believe you could fit a laptop and a couple days worth of clothes plus shoes and toiletries plus a phone and wallet and keys or meds..... this bag barely fits my laptop, switch, one RX bottle, a box of ibuprofen and my headphones.Good things about the bag :I like the strap on the back to hold your bag to a roller suitcase. Definitely helped save my back.The power bank port is nice. I have a larger power bank and that did not help my case with the lack of space, but being able to plug into the exterior of my bag instead of digging around for the bank at the bottom of my bag to use it was nice.The wet pocket is cool. I can shove my wet wipes and eyedrops in there without worrying of spillage. However I think that pocket is much larger than it needed to be.Overall it's a good bag. Just don't expect it to replace your carry on.

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: Firstly, these jeans are made in china and are not Motherhood. I think it's important for Amazon to state this as what is advertised is not what you get.I ordered two pairs to see which would be the best fit. The larger size arrived first. The fit was ok but I was really hoping the smaller size would be bang on. I waited and waited but they never came and the return period for the larger size expired.So I have a pair of these jeans that are a bit big for me. They're made well but I find the 'over bump' top of the jeans rolls down so I am constantly pulling them up.Overall I am disappointed with the product but mainly in their marketing than the product. If the smaller ones had arrived I would definitely kept them and this would be a whole different review.

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: A m√≠ esposa le gustaron mucho, no le quedaron ni muy entubados ni muy aguados, se le baja un poco de la panza ya que la tiene a√∫n peque√±a pero conforme le vaya creciendo se sostendr√° un poco m√°s , es talla 5 de pantal√≥n y la talla M fue la adecuada para su cuerpo

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: El pantal√≥n es s√∫per c√≥modo y buen agarre en la parte de la mezclilla aunque mancha un poco los art√≠culos que colocas en las bolsas y la piel.. ya lo lav√© varias veces y sigue manchando.. fuera de eso todo bien

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: I really like these jeans but the sizing is off. I bought both the small and medium to compare and see which which sizing felt best to me. I'm a size 4 prepregnancy and according to the chart should be a small but am generally between sizes so ordered both just in case, and I'm glad I did. The jeans are stretchy and I like the medium wash but the small pair I received is bigger than the medium pair. (See photos) The colors are slightly different too with the medium being a bit lighter than the small but not a big difference. I tried on the medium first and was surprised to see they felt a bit tight (still wearable but tighter than I would have thought/preferred). I wasn't even going to bother trying on the small but realized the small looked bigger than the medium so tried on and they felt similar but a bit loser than the medium. I then measured them because I thought that was odd and sure enough the small is bigger. I double checked the tags inside and the sizing is correct and the styles are identical so not sure what happened. Length fits me great - I'm 5'2'' and debated ordering petite but glad I ordered the regular instead. I wanted to purchase another pair in a different color as well but can't due to not knowing wht size to order!

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: For $18 I am thrilled with these maternity pants! I‚Äôm just approaching 20 weeks and my bump finally started to pop. I‚Äôm not someone who wears jeans a lot, but figured I needed at least one pair to get through the rest of winter and spring. Still, I couldn‚Äôt imagine spending $40-$50 on jeans I would only wear a handful of times. These fit the bill!The belly band part is extremely comfortable- snug enough to fit me now with just a tiny bump but with plenty of room to grow with me! Im folding the belly band in half in the meantime and it seems to work great! At 5‚Äô3‚Äù they are just a touch long and the ankles are a little baggy but still fit much better than I was expecting- I have that issue with almost any jeans I buy! My biggest complaint is that I do have a decent booty so the seam where the jeans meet the belly band feels a bit low, like i can‚Äôt quite get them all the way over my butt. Overall, I‚Äôm very pleased with these jeans for the price and they‚Äôll be great to have on hand for the rare occasion I do wear them!For reference, pre pregnancy I was a 2 or XS for most pants, initial pregnant weight gain pushed me into a 4 regular jeans and I JUST outgrew them at 20 weeks. I ordered a small and they fit great!

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: These jeans are ok, but beware if you are tall! I'm 5'8 and they land above my ankle so not true "skinny jeans" that you could tuck into low boots but fine for tennis shoes or rolling up. They're also a little bulky around the hips and the tag in the back is very scratchy. Keeping them because I needed something in a pinch but wouldn't buy again.

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: One of the most annoying things about maternity pants is that some mediums are HUGE and some are very small. These are smaller than I expected. I‚Äôm hoping they stretch out a bit after extended wearing, then I can maintain them by washing on cool.

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: The GoodI really do like the fact that these jeans look like regular pants, my husband didn't even notice they were maternity jeans until he saw me taking them off several weeks later.  They're a dark wash and the color has survived many washes (being pregnant makes me sweaty and I wash my clothes much more than I had before I hit the second trimester).  The back pockets are functional, BUT...The BadThe pockets in the back do indeed work but the elastic that goes around my belly doesn't do a whole lot to keep these up.  When I put my phone in my back pocket (and I do this often because I listen to audiobooks and use headphones for phone calls) it weighs my pants down.  I can't keep my phone there without having to pull up my pants constantly, even if I'm not moving around very much.  Even with my phone out of my pocket the pants don't stay up for very long.  It's so annoying and embarrassing to have to constantly be pulling them up.  The problem is a little better after they're freshly washed but not more than a couple of hours.I think they're a nice fit, but from the nature of my job and the fact that I can't keep my phone in my back pocket makes me not want to wear them or purchase them again.  I know it's not a size issue because the three other pairs of pants/shorts I purchased were all mediums and don't have this problem.  If you don't move around a whole lot or don't need the pockets then these might work for you.

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: I have narrow hips, and found this fit extremely awkward, too awkward to wear. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7 and was 150 lbs pre-pregnancy (size 6-8) and I ordered the medium. First, the jeans portion of these is SUPER low (think ultra lo-rise jeans from early 2000‚Äôs), and the stretchy tummy part is way too big and stretchy. Second, the legs were a little baggy on me (I was hoping for a more skinny jeans fit). It looked and felt horribly awkward, and when I walked they would slide down.

titulo: Jeans Motherhood Maternity
comentario: It does the job but it's a random brand called indigo not motherhood. I think amazon should crack down on false advertising because it's pretty disappointing. As a result it doesn't fit properly. The crotch is pretty low causing my thighs to touch and it gets uncomfortable after a while.Also I'm 6 f and these are definitely way too short and not skinny legs.I didnt return them because I wear them but definitely not my favourite and no motherhood brand means cheap quality.Would not recommend

titulo: KODAK C√¢mera digital PIXPRO Zoom FZ55-BK de 16 MP com zoom √≥ptico de 5 x 28 mm de largura angular e tela LCD de 2,7 polegadas (preta)
comentario: DISLIKES:  No external charger for the battery.  Most digital cameras I have purchased in the past always came with an external charger.  This one only charges the battery internally, unless you buy an external charger, which I would highly recommend one always have an external charger for extra/spare batteries for your camera!  Also didn't like you only access the manual by reading or downloading on-line.  What is wrong with manufacturers today?  They SHOULD supply manuals with their products, no matter what it is.  Not have the end user go hunting for it, and many times when I went seeking a manual for a product I bought, if the manufacturer may have discontinued the item, they tend to remove the manual, and now it's no longer available to access, even though you may have bought the item new, no manual with it is just dumb and lazy on their part.  If I am printing it on paper, then they sure didn't save any trees, and maybe I had to print it several times before I got the fomatting right to put it in a notebook or folder for future reference, wasting paper and more trees.  Manufactures take notice, you ARE NOT doing the trees or the end user any favor by EXCLUDING manuals from your products!LIKES:  Easy to use, but then I have been accustomed to digital cameras for a very long time, so I can navigate around them very easily, and I found this one very easy to navigateonce I checked out all the buttons and what they did.  Has a nice LCD screen for viewing your photo's after taking the shots, one thing I don't quite understand is the "slideshow", you get 3 options to pick from #1, #2 or #3,  #1 just shows the basic snapshot and really does nothing.  #2 will do some type of effect, as does #3, but to me, they make no rhyme or reason for even being there at all.They don't copy to your computer when transferring the photo's to your computer, you'd have to use another program, like some kind of video editor to create a slide show with similar or like effects.  And the issue is, it's NOT a slide show of the photo's in the camera or on the SD Card, it only affects the ONE PHOTO you're viewing, so it's not a slideshow by any means.  When I selected it to see what it did, it just affected the one photo I was viewing, I had expected to see a slideshow of ALL the photo's I had taken or be allowed to select a specific number to create a slideshow that could be saved as a video exported file from the camera, but none of that is possible.  Waste of a camera resource in my opinion.The photos are good, and I have attached a few here to show the cameras' capability in low light conditions, the two photo's of the same kitten (Cordellia-001/-002) are indoors in low light, the older cat (Apollo), taken outside is nearing sunset.  Forgive the messy look of the floor inside the house, we're in the process of removing the carpeting from our house, and we're just starting work on it, so the floors look a tad messy for the time being.Even with the Dislikes and the few faults it has, I can recommend the camera, it seems to take nice photographs, I haven't tried videos as yet, I have some projects in mind for that for YouTube later on.  I mostly purchased this camera for still photos when on nature walks or other outside activities that may be photo-worthy.

titulo: KODAK C√¢mera digital PIXPRO Zoom FZ55-BK de 16 MP com zoom √≥ptico de 5 x 28 mm de largura angular e tela LCD de 2,7 polegadas (preta)
comentario: This camera fulfils an additional purpose that my cellphone cannot, and that my small wide-angle-lens 4k action camera also cannot: It has an optical zoom.I had searched the internet looking for a camera with an optical zoom, and this is the best value I found.In the end, I do not care that it can't record in 4k video, or that the picture resolution may be a little smaller than what is possible today on newer devices.I have a limited use case, where at times, I need to zoom a photo specifically to the area of the subject being photographed, and I want to do so without losing detail.This is what this camera is great for.It is not as convenient as taking out your phone quickly and taking a photo. But it ensures that when you do use it, you will likely get a more professional looking shot.Esta c√°mara cumple un prop√≥sito adicional que mi celular no puede, y que mi peque√±a c√°mara de acci√≥n 4k con lente gran angular tampoco: tiene un zoom √≥ptico.Hab√≠a buscado en Internet una c√°mara con zoom √≥ptico, y este es el mejor valor que encontr√©.Al final, no me importa que no pueda grabar en video 4k, o que la resoluci√≥n de la imagen sea un poco m√°s peque√±a de lo que es posible hoy en d√≠a en los dispositivos m√°s nuevos.Tengo un caso de uso limitado, en el que, a veces, necesito acercar una foto espec√≠ficamente al √°rea del sujeto que se est√° fotografiando, y quiero hacerlo sin perder detalles.Para eso es genial esta c√°mara.No es tan conveniente como sacar r√°pidamente el tel√©fono y tomar una foto. Pero asegura que cuando lo use, es probable que obtenga una toma de aspecto m√°s profesional.

titulo: CANON 7549 C√¢mera Digital Powershot, Sx740 Hs, Preta
comentario: If you're in the market for a high-quality point-and-shoot camera that delivers exceptional image quality, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0" LCD is an excellent option. This camera is packed with features that make it easy to capture stunning photos and videos, whether you're a professional photographer or a hobbyist.One of the standout features of this camera is its 40x optical zoom, which is accompanied by an optical image stabilizer and zoom framing assist. This means that you can get up close and personal with your subject matter, without worrying about camera shake or blurriness. The zoom framing assist is particularly helpful, as it helps you to keep your subject centered in the frame, even when you're zooming in or out.Another great feature of the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is its ability to shoot 4K video and 4K time-lapse movies. This means that you can capture stunning footage in incredibly high resolution, which is perfect for creating high-quality videos or time-lapse sequences.In addition to its impressive video capabilities, this camera also features a 20.3 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers sharp, detailed images with accurate color reproduction. This is particularly useful when shooting in low light conditions, as the sensor is able to capture more light than other cameras in its class.Finally, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is also equipped with high-speed continuous shooting, which allows you to capture fast-moving action with ease. Whether you're photographing sports, wildlife, or other fast-paced subjects, this feature ensures that you never miss a moment.Overall, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0" LCD is an excellent choice for anyone who wants a high-quality camera that delivers exceptional image quality, impressive video capabilities, and a range of advanced features. Highly recommended!

titulo: CANON 7549 C√¢mera Digital Powershot, Sx740 Hs, Preta

titulo: CANON 7549 C√¢mera Digital Powershot, Sx740 Hs, Preta
comentario: Most challenging picture so far has been a red bellied woodpecker(they don't stay still) in a tree across the street. Can be done Must brace camera, Zoom is "super". Better image quality, better lense cover, than previous Canon Powershot SX 160. But I liked the slightly larger size of the older camera, easier to hold still fit in pocket, used AA batteries. Haven't used connective features of camera, just use the cable to transfer pics. Fiddley/frail flash. Pretend its not there and you won't break it. I prefer not to manipulate pics, have not downloaded app. Can't stand the loss of privacy when sharing life history in order to access online features.

titulo: CANON 7549 C√¢mera Digital Powershot, Sx740 Hs, Preta
comentario: I bought this specifically for the 40x zoom since my iPhone digital zoom is trash.This is great for wildlife encounters in daily life, and that‚Äôs it. The image quality is abysmal for selfies although there‚Äôs a flip up screen so if you are looking for a selfie cam this is not the one. If you want a selfie camera, get the NX mini from Samsung, or an RX100 series from Sony-which both sport a 1‚Äù sensor. Or get the Panasonic LX10 since that has a f1.4 which is great for portraits.I took this out just now to take photos of squirrels and it has served it‚Äôs purpose well. The weather condition was cloudy with a bit rain, but it still served well in taking photos in mediocre lighting. Note that it‚Äôs not weatherproof so always listen to the weather forecast before taking it out.Overall. This is the best compact zoom that servers the longest zoom range with a decent price point and purpose if you know what you are using it for.

titulo: CANON 7549 C√¢mera Digital Powershot, Sx740 Hs, Preta
comentario: I bought this camera with the intention of taking on an upcoming trip to Italy.  I wanted something versatile enough to capture landscapes but also some occasional wildlife.  I found that the auto focus works pretty well even if you're shooting a cluttered subject like a bird in a tree.  The first photo is a basic landscape.  The color is true and the image is fairly crisp.  The second image is of a screech owl in a nesting box.  I zoomed in pretty much as far as the camera would go.  The image is not of good quality.  I was using a monopod to help stabilize the camera but that wasn't the issue.  The image is pretty badly pixilated.  The 3rd, 4th, and 5th images are of the same wall I found in the woods.  As you zoom in you can see that the sharpness goes out the window.  The last two images were taken with the lens at what I would estimate was about 300mm on a standard SLR camera.  The images turned out pretty good.  Overall I give the camera 4 stars because of it's ease of use, it's convenient small size, and photo quality between what I'd estimate is about 30mm and 300mm.  But if you're looking to use this camera for wildlife, forget it.  Trying to find active animals, such as birds, on the screen is frustrating and the image quality is just not good when you go beyond 300mm.

titulo: CANON 7549 C√¢mera Digital Powershot, Sx740 Hs, Preta
comentario: If you're in the market for a high-quality point-and-shoot camera that delivers exceptional image quality, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0" LCD is an excellent option. This camera is packed with features that make it easy to capture stunning photos and videos, whether you're a professional photographer or a hobbyist.One of the standout features of this camera is its 40x optical zoom, which is accompanied by an optical image stabilizer and zoom framing assist. This means that you can get up close and personal with your subject matter, without worrying about camera shake or blurriness. The zoom framing assist is particularly helpful, as it helps you to keep your subject centered in the frame, even when you're zooming in or out.Another great feature of the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is its ability to shoot 4K video and 4K time-lapse movies. This means that you can capture stunning footage in incredibly high resolution, which is perfect for creating high-quality videos or time-lapse sequences.In addition to its impressive video capabilities, this camera also features a 20.3 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers sharp, detailed images with accurate color reproduction. This is particularly useful when shooting in low light conditions, as the sensor is able to capture more light than other cameras in its class.Finally, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is also equipped with high-speed continuous shooting, which allows you to capture fast-moving action with ease. Whether you're photographing sports, wildlife, or other fast-paced subjects, this feature ensures that you never miss a moment.Overall, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0" LCD is an excellent choice for anyone who wants a high-quality camera that delivers exceptional image quality, impressive video capabilities, and a range of advanced features. Highly recommended!

This is the best compact zoom that servers the longest zoom range with a decent price point and purpose if you know what you are using it for.
